http://www.universesandbox.com/buy/

I have been eagerly awaiting this FOR 3 YEARS. When I get time, I will mess around with the new public alpha.

Did he just make it? I thought it was dead.

Yay!

Did he just make it? I thought it was dead.

Yay!

Actually, their team has grown a lot. I've been following alpha development for a while now.
Aw, I bought the previous version literally three days ago. I knew this version was coming, but figured it would be a while.
Chad (C7) was working on this. Great to see a release.
Yes! There is mac Support!

YAY!

I'm buying this ASAP.
So much for saving my money.

Awww yeaaaa!!

I don't have a bank account...goddammit.

Edited August 27, 2014 by Spartwo

Like four days ago universe sandbox 2 was released in alpha for $25 dollars, it has working climate for planets, improved impacts, and much more.

I want my terraformable planets!

*makes the moon habbitable*

Whoa- atmospheres? climates?? impacts that arent little z-fighting white circles?

I'm totally down for this, but does it have a Linux version yet?

Whoa- atmospheres? climates?? impacts that arent little z-fighting white circles?

I'm totally down for this, but does it have a Linux version yet?

Yes there's a Linux version
http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92000-Universe-Sandbox-2-Public-Alpha-Released%21?p=1377602#post1377602

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92000-Universe-Sandbox-2-Public-Alpha-Released%21?p=1377602#post1377602

Whoops, I didn't see that, sorry.
Here's a video I made from during the early alpha. Lots of changes since then!
Why were the planets bouncy at the beginning?

Why were the planets bouncy at the beginning?

This was always a feature, you can have bouncy or impact collisions.
Have they made galaxies behave more realistically? There's one example in the promotional vid, but it's terribly blurry.

Have they made galaxies behave more realistically? There's one example in the promotional vid, but it's terribly blurry.

They are still working on galaxies, Giant Army admits those need a lot of love. The final product should include dark matter, however. Something the first edition did not have.

Edited September 2, 2014 by Camacha
Didn't realise they were making an new one, ooo and Linux support.
Glad to see it released! I had fun alpha testing it!
Haha, wow. I registered in this forum just to start a thread like this. I'm so excited about US

They are still working on galaxies, Giant Army admits those need a lot of love. The final product should include dark matter, however. Something the first edition did not have.

Am I missing something? I didn't think anyone knew what dark matter was. I thought it was just a theory to try and explain away unexplained astronomical observations.

Am I missing something? I didn't think anyone knew what dark matter was. I thought it was just a theory to try and explain away unexplained astronomical observations.

You are right, we have little understanding of the nature of it. That does not mean, however, that you cannot add that factor to simulations so that they respond like in real life. Whatever is it, we understand what it does well enough to do that. That might or might not turn out to be wrong later, but jives with what we know now.

Of course, the term explaining away might be a little simplistic, there are a lot of people looking at it and various observations have been made that seem to point in the suggested direction. By calling it explaining away you are implying it is some rogue hypothesis without any thought or merit.

Edited September 3, 2014 by Camacha

I didn't think anyone knew what dark matter was.
Dark matter was proposed to explain the way galaxies rotate. If the game reproduces that motion, the game makers don't have to pin down the true nature of dark matter for the simulation to run realistically.
